Last night, my daughter and I ventured off to NYC and had dinner at Skirt Steak in the Flat Iron district. My daughter has been wanting to go here for some time after seeing it on TikTok. She s a steak lover and I love French fries so this place combined the best of both worlds. Skirt Steak had gone viral for its prix fixe menu where you order your 6oz skirt steak to your liking; well, medium well, medium or rare. This is accompanied by a salad with a little olive based dressing, and unlimited fries for $45. Other than fries, they do offer other sides which are limited: Scalloped potatoes with cheese & bacon and broccoli. Their sides are $12 additional and are ever changing, so expect something different if you go. They also offer an assortment of desserts for $12 as well. The beverage menu was a little limited that started at about $6. Overall the ambiance of the restaurant was quaint and intimate. If you go, expect a line at the door and the waiting time may average about 15 to 20 minutes depending on the size of your party. I was satisfied and I enjoyed my experience. My daughter and I order our skirt steaks medium which was served with a bearnaise sauce. In addition to the salad and unlimited French fries we order the potatoes smothered with cheese & bacon. I ordered a regular margarita which was pretty strong and my daughter ordered a Diet Coke. We also ordered dessert. I ordered a chocolate cake with icing and my daughter ordered the bloody orange tart. My chocolate cake was underwhelming but my daughter s dessert tasted like fruit loops  I really liked the tart. I didn t know what to expect since my daughter picked it but we both enjoyed our dinner experience at Skirt Steak. This is the place for you if you love red meat  there are NO other protein options. It s a pretty straightforward and to the point menu without the frills. I highly recommend getting your steak prepared medium as it was cooked to perfection. I would definitely return. I give it a 9/10

review_text: They only have 1 Entree, but they make it to perfection. The steak, fries, salad, and peppercorn burnaise were all incredible. I always thought skirt steak was a lesser quality cut, but they perform miracles with it. I highly recommend it!

I finally had the pleasure of eating here and I was very satisfied. There is always a wait here, but it usually goes quickly. I waited about 20 minutes on a Friday. I sat at the bar and was greeted promptly by the bartender. I was started off with a field greens salad that had a light tart dressing and a strong flavor from fresh dill. The steak comes at 3 temperatures; rare, medium, or well. I went with the rare. The steak was cooked perfectly to rare and had wonderful taste. The bearnaise sauce was the beat Ive had in a long time. Rich and smooth, on the thinner side as it should be. The fries were a perfect thin and crunchy shoe string style. The fries are unlimited, and I was asked if I wanted a refill, which I appreciated. Honestly, youre not going to beat the value. For what youre paying vs. the quality of food. I really feel like you win here. Highly recommended and will be back again. Vegetarian options: None. Parking: Garages in the area. Limited street parking.

review_text: What to say? Truly a brilliant place. It was what was needed in NY city. Once we arrived we queued for about 20 metres. We preferred to wait for the table but still waited very little (about 15 minutes). Once inside I appreciated the style of the place and the order in the furnishings (it seems like a superior place). We were immediately brought a drink and a nice plate of salad while the host showed us the restaurants fixed dish, and yes! Because the local formula is: 1. A plate of salad served immediately 2. A cut of beef cooked to your needs. 3. All you can it chips. The meat was very soft, the salad non-trivial and the chips crunchy (but I add a little too salty). Optimal. The bill was fair for how we were treated and for what we ate (about 100 dollars for two), but considering that very famous places in NY charge you 30 dollars for a toast  we can say that it is a fair price. Well done.

The salad dressing tasted better, and the fried were still yummy. The cocktails are pretty standard for NYC overpriced drinks. I havent had dessert from there since Im always full after the meal. Would recommend trying at least once.

I had a wonderful dinner at Skirt Steak, a cozy and casual steakhouse in Midtown that serves a set-course menu of skirt steak with bearnaise sauce, field greens, and nearly unlimited fries. Summary: good concept almost carbon-copied from French restaurant chain Relais de LEntrecote- and notably misses the mark on key elements. The Good: Overall, the restaurant decor, service, and food were top tier. Our server was Larissa, and we felt very much that we were well waited on throughout the night! For a Thursday night, we waited ~20 minutes, which I thought was perfect for a bustling restaurant. The ambience felt very warm and welcoming, and I loved the wooden columns and decor. The dessert selection was also excellent and very much on par with other NYC restaurants. The Not Good: Frankly, Im only giving this restaurant 3 stars because, as a concept, Relais de LEntrecote does it better. Charging $2 for extra Bearnaise felt very slimy, and felt like the restaurant was being stingy rather than willing to get people to try their linchpin ingredient that ties the steak and fries together. Relais also serves 2 portions of steak initially, then follows up with another portion of steak - meanwhile, Skirt Steak only serves the initial two portions (perfectly cooked, I recommend rare here), then does not allow for further portions. That second portion makes all the difference at the other restaurant, as it helps keep you satisfied in your appetite- here, I wanted more, but all I had were fries with no sauce and no meat :(. Other minor points are to add salt and pepper to the table - I actually wanted the salt for the fries, not the meat, but it felt trite to have to ask for these condiments at a steak restaurant of all places, where there will be a vast range of steak preferences from different patrons. Generally speaking, I really liked this place, and wanted it to succeed- it is succeeding too! I just know that other places with a very similar premise have features that make the dining experience there that much more satisfying. Keep up the good work, and I hope some of my critique takes root.

this was a huge scam 35 dollars for a two gram steak and it was COAL. My mouth is burning from the unlimited salty fries.
The meat portion is way too small, it was tasty tho.

Excellent fixed priced dinner - salad, skirt steak and all you can eat fries = $35, great appetizers, desserts and drinks are extra. You usually have a short wait to get in as no reservation for parties under 6 but the wait is well worth it! Just tried it last Saturday and Ill definitely be back often! Though meals can be fast as they have the service down, I didnt feel rushed. If I was going to the theater I would definitely consider catching dinner at Skirt Steak!
Excellent meat at a fair price!
review_translated_text: Carne ottima prezzo giusto!

review_text: Was invited by friends to hang out and I really enjoyed it - 5/5 recommend. Good place to chill and hang out. The staff were super friendly and attentive. The food was delicious! We came on a Saturday afternoon and were able to get seated asap. Although, we did hear there would be a line to get seated and I could see why.

This place was new to me. Super cute, chilled atmosphere. The menu is very straight to the point, salad, skirt steak and unlimited french fries. 4 stars only because the steak was so good I wish the serving was a lil bigger... other then that I will definitely return.

The prix fixe is now $35 instead of $28, that s a 25% increase in less than a year! And nothing changed beside the line being shorter  . I don t think it s worth going anymore, this place was worth it for the price but now it s just expensive for what it is. If you re ok paying that price, then give it a try. Also please don t wait in line, it s not worth it.
response_from_owner_text: Something did change: what we pay for the ingredients. We don t expect everyone to understand inflation at a time like this, but it s still a great value for the quality of ingredients we use and the amount of food received for the cost.

review_text: Meh. The portions were really small. Could ve a better dinner for the same price somewhere else. The service was the only good thing.
Not worth the hype.

Saw this restaurant on tic tick so I decided to try it out the service overall was very good I bought two servings the steak, French fries and salad I ordered two drinks total was $91.46 (tip not included in this cost). It s a nice little spot staffs are very friendly. This restaurant is really a one time experience for me don t think I will go back though.

Maybe it was the overhype from social media. Maybe it was the increase in prices from when it opened this earlier this year. But I was a bit underwhelmed. Drinks were solid and that garlic bread was on point. Steak was fine but can only choose 3 temps and portions definitely were not filling (for me at least). Id rather spend extra and goto a real steakhouse. Service was much slower than I expected. I wouldnt go out of my way to go back or wait in a long line.

$35 you get salad, steak and unlimited fries. The food overall is good but not great and you get decent worth for your money. One thing to note you get two pieces of steak on top of each other, the one above was cooked to perfection, however the one below was slightly over cooked because of the hot pan. We had to wait 25 mins on Saturday evening around 7PM, which the waiter mentioned is quick for Saturday generally much more busy. Recommend the place, however doubt I ll be visiting again anytime soon. 3.5/5

Did not have to wait long, as we got here about 30 mins before opening. The steak is a small portion it s was okay. Drinks are okay as well. Amazing desert was really the icing on the cake I sure did enjoy the chocolate cake and the banana cake as well.
Nice place. Not worth the wait time and line. Come back if they ever do reservations.

I was going to write a review immediately after I came out from this place. My husband, a friend and I went to this place on Aug 12. We all had been wanting  to try this place for a while and that day was the day. So, a long line outside should be a good indicator, but once we were seated, the waiter gave us only the drunk list and start telling us in speed of a roadrunner of all items on the menu, not offering any other menu, not trying to tell us to look at the board above our table. Was he expecting us to remember the 1st item he mentioned when he finished his 15th items? Hellll no. He tried to upsell and maybe trying to use the confusion strategy to get peoplenot, mostly are tourists, to nod...get $$$$. Most importantly, if he had to talk that much trying to upset his items, he should have worn a mask. I know its not mandatory anymore for COVID. But there are other things beside COVID that come with the saliva. ....thats to me was the 1st red flag. So, we ended up getting their basic set. It started with the salad. A generous amount of salad which was unedible. We all had a bit or two and we put our fork down. It didnt look fresh. My husband and our friend said it was bitter. I said the veggies look old and the salad dressing is horrible. When the meat came with fries, the meat portion was smaller than what we expected, not like Les Venise steak house on Lexington. The fries was oily. So, we just finished the meat, paid and leave. Beside food, my husband ordered a coke, they brought Diet Coke. I normally would order an alcoholic drink and dessert when dinning out, but not this time. I dont feel like giving more money to support the poor services. I would give a 3 stars to one of the food runner...he did a great job in serving us and he should be promoted as a main waiter.
Quality eats! Perfect steak, fries and drinks. Went here after a party and had great vibes. Top notch social media engagement too. Would come here with a big fun group.

If you want a small but good quality piece of meat with fries and green salad for USD30, this is the place. The rest, everything is charged separately (even the bread). Excellent attention from the staff. You have to arrive at 5 p.m. to have a place in the restaurant, otherwise you can wait up to 60 minutes in line to enter.
review_translated_text: Si quieres un trozo de carne pequeno pero  de buena calidad con papas fritas y ensalada verde por USD30, este es el lugar. Lo demas, todo lo cobran aparte (hasta el pan). Excelente atencion del personal. Hay que llegar a las 17 hrs  para tener un lugar en el restaurant, de lo contrario puedes esperar hasta 60 min en la fila para entrar.

review_text: Good value  30 dollar steak dinner if you dont  want to spend 90 bucks per person, The skirt steak meat cut is a little chewy but prepared to  order and tasty.
Delicious, fast and efficient service.
Unbelievably great. I will see the desert cart (and its lovely operator, I hope) in my dreams.

This place was great. For 30$pp they serve a nice portion of skirt steak with a side of unlimited fries! The steak was super tasty and they serve it with a delicious sauce on the side. Just be aware that they only serve skirt here no other entrees. They give 2 skirt steak options regular or wagyu. It s definitely worth every penny. No reservations here only walk-in. Line tends to get long so be ready to wait on line. But 100% worth it!
Ordered a medium steak and it came out so overcooked that my jaw hurt from chewing -- had to send back to the kitchen 2 times and they still couldnt get it right...

Runn!!!! Dont spend your money here!!      Waited on line for 20 minutes, no big deal. Line moved fast. My waiter was amazing and sweet. I ordered a wagyu steak and skirt steak, waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for my order. RIDICULOUS! Asked for both steaks medium and it came out medium well almost well-done . At that point waiting almost 2 hours for steak I was in such disappointment. Once I got the steaks it was ANOTHER WAIT FOR FRIES!;    The flavor of the skirt steak was bland AND SMALL. Youre better off going to a Cuban restaurant that serves better skirt steak. Overall this place is overhyped and overrated.

The steaks were okay, and the fries were okay. Basically like people say you get what you pay for. We waited 40 minutes in the line outside. I would not go back because wait is to long and food is okay at best.
Unique dish of a good steak with potatoes
review_translated_text: Plat unic de un bon filet amb patates

review_text: Server was good. The restaurant has a good atmosphere. Drinks were good too. We did not like that salad and the bread, next time we will skip those. The skirt steak was ok and the French Fries are addictive

Great simple concept. The menu: Skirt Steak.(upgrade to wagyu optional) Sides. Beer, wine,  spirits and cocktails. Thats all. The staff is friendly, food comes out quick, sauce that comes with the steak (some sort of ?horseradish? Herb Gravy) is tasty. My ONLY criticism is that they precut your steak into large chunks, but the chunks are cut along the grain instead of across, which would have made it easier to slice into bite sized pieces and a more tender chew.
Excellent!
review_translated_text: Excelente!

review_text: Came in because the place is trending on tik tok. Waited in line for more than 30 min. It is worth the visit because it is a cool concept and a different dining experience. The steak was great quality and had good taste but it has a very grill/charcoal flavor on the outside that is really strong so not my favorite steak. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive, the food comes pretty fast which was nice.
Nice steak and unlimited fries, limited spaces to seating during time I visit and long time waiting outside
Their is steak is good, but I don t understand why they raised the price of the skirt steak.
Great value for money  it is exactly as advertised
Lucky find on TikTok. Simple menu, pretty straightforward. Best Midtown steak!!

My sister and I loved the concept of this place. Very simple: salad, steak and UNLIMITED fries = Perfect combination. We ate at the bar which was fine by us, but I think I will ask for a table next time.

This place has a very simple menu, which is pretty nice. Salad, steak, and fries nothing complex about it. That being said, the skirt steak was quite delicious, though it s also hard to mess up skirt steak. The star of the meal is definitely the peppercorn sauce, that pairs exceptionally well with the steak. They also have non alcoholic drinks which is a big plus, but I thought they could ve been priced a little more reasonably

We love this restaurant but they should post accurate hours of operation.  Their website says they are open until 10:30pm.  We walked in 9:45pm after planning our evening around eating there ( they don t take reservations) and we re turned away because they stop seating at 9:30pm which seems very off for NYC.
Best steak in the midtown

An amazing deal! I was worried we were going to have a long wait because of others reviews, we got there half an hour after they opened and got seated right away. The service was amazing and the steak is amazing for the price!
It was alright. Steak was pretty small. Fries were good.

Beautiful ambiance. Dimmed lights classic/ modern look. Deliciously seasoned steak that comes at the correct temperature in which you order it. Crispy nicely seasoned French fries with unlimited refills. Lemonade is made correctly not to sour not to sweet. Now the only thing I would complain about is the garlic bread. It was savory but unfortunately to hard to chew. Salad was a healthy option, seasoned with only light vinaigrette dressing. Overall beautiful experience here at skirt steak. Thank you for having me

I went to this place in the winter and the line was long and not moving.  After an half hour in the cold we left.  My husband and I live in Queens but we went to Manhattan just to try this place that got rave reviews.  We returned and arrived about 10 minutes before opening and although there was a line, we were in the first group to fill this small restaurant.  The menu is very limited - including steak, fries, heirloom tomato salad, salad and corn on the cobb.  The fries are unlimited.  They offered 2 kinds of steak.  One $30 and the premium steak at $60.  I am very particular about my steak being tender, so I ordered the $60 steak. It was very good.  The pricing was reasonable and the service was fast, efficient and friendly.   I would recommend this place to a friend.
Amazing skirt steak, the truffle fries were perfect, and this tomato salad they have was good too
Fantastic place. Found it on tik tok! Would recommend
Food is pretty good, but the steak portion is not enough for 1 person, so be prepared to get comfortable with just fries. Other than that, the waitress was very attentive.
The steak was SENSATIONAL!! Endless fries was a great touch as well! Ill definitely be back.
Place was great for the price point. Would definitely come back. I noticed the steak has gotten smaller compared to the first time I went. But the food was good nonetheless.
Come here if you want spend a fortune to drink gallons of grease. Best thing about this place was the free bread, and its only free for the first basket.
Simple menu- skirt steak and French fries. Steak was delicious, fries were plentiful. Sides were great. Heirloom tomato salad and grilled zucchini. The only negative is that theres a line to get in.

Nice set up menu, skirt steak is around $30, and wagyu beef was $60.We choose the skirt steak, serve with a nice salad, and unlimited fries, meat was cooked on your term ( I got medium rare).The desert cart wasnt look that great. But, in the overall experience  was positive, good service, nice size portion.If you are around flatiron/ nomad area, and dont mind to wait in line around 30 minutes, you should try it.

We ate very well and above all had a good time. The restaurant does not take reservations and you have to wait because it is crowded (on average 30 minutes). Skip the wait, the service is fast, efficient and above all pleasant. For $30 you get a salad, steak and fries (which you can have twice). The meat was very good and the fries too!
review_translated_text: Nous avons tres bien mange et surtout passe un bon moment. Le restaurant ne prend pas les reservations et vous devez attendre car il y a du monde (en moyenne 30 minutes). Passez l attente, le service est rapide, efficace et surtout agreable. Pour 30$ vous avez une salade un steak et des frites (que vous pouvez reprendre 2 fois). La viande etait tres bonne et les frites aussi!

review_text: Everything was Awesome!
The wait was short and the steak was delicious
The Fries were so GOOD me and my friend went and it was 65 in total steak was ok

Long lines, simple menu, friendly staff, but too long of a time to be served food. Especially when its a fixed menu. Also they need to do something about the fries. They were probably made hours ago as there is no other reason for them to be stale.

$30 best deal in NYC! Perfectly cooked skirt steak, salad, and unlimited French frys. This place is very nice. No wait at 9:00 pm. You will be happy. The pics are sides of heirloom tomatoes with feta, and roasted zucchini in a cream sauce. Delicious. Ignore the reviews batching about the wait. There can be a wait because it us so good for the price. I am from Arkansas. No dog in that hunt. Perfect place to eat.
I love the medium rare steak here, the bread and also the fries also tasty. I love coming back here

Steak was not bad! $132 for 3 steaks  4 bites of steak each. And we sat in the street for some reason, 88 degrees at night. Over all. 2/5. Don t fall for the hype. They seem to work to keep a line at all times.
Simple but excellent!

It was very tasty, the steak was juicy and flavorful, the fries are thin and crunchy. Their prosecco was okiiii. The staff was nice. My main complaint was that it was super hot. I wouldnt give it 5 stars.

Since theres no reservations for this place for small parties, waited a little bit...then got seated at the bar for a party of 2. Enjoyed the $30 pre-fixe menu (salad, skirt steak, and unlimited fries) plus we ordered some sides of garlic bread, zucchini, Mexican corn, and some cocktails and mocktails. Pretty delicious food and drinks on point.
Fantastic concept, 30 dollars to eat your fill. Unlimited fries and delicious steak, thats all you need!
review_translated_text: Fantastisch concept, 30 dollar voor je buikje vol gegeten te hebben. Unlimited fries en heerlijke steak, meer heb je niet nodig!

review_text: A pretty no frills place for a meal. $30 per person, a portion of salad, a portion of skirt steak and unlimited fries. Drinks and desserts are available at additional cost of course. Saw this place while searching for a late dinner spot and decided to give this place a try. Didnt have to queue for long at 8:30pm and got a table pretty soon. Service wise, there are dedicated staff to take your orders, or to serve you food, so even if the staff passed by who is free, they wont entertain you. Food wise, the salad was normal. Would love to have some variety of vegetables instead of all greens, and even the sauce for salad. Skirt Steak was medium done as requested, charred on the outside and pretty much medium rare inside. This is probably my first time trying the skirt part of the steak so the taste was pretty good. Each portion of skirt steak comes with a small serving of sauce and $2 additional if you ask for more. The fries were nothing much to talk about. Its basically fries. Overall, its a casual place for dinner, do come at a later time to get a table easily, but the staff will kinda clear your table as soon as they can. As an overseas tourist myself, I guess its something different to experience in Skirt Steak.
Delicious but service needs to be improved
Friendly staff but a bit forgetful with some orders/ requests. Food was good, but the steak was a bit chewy.

This spot is definitely a must do if you re in town. I had a reservation (it was a large party) so there was no long line to wait on. Started off with a salad that personally I was not a fan of (it has fennel & anise on top, wish someone told me). The steak was great! The flavor and temperature were perfect & the bearnaise sauce was a nice touch. Fries, c mon, who doesn t love UNLIMITED fries!? I will say that some were more well done then others but they were still delicious. 9 out of 10 would go back for more!

NOT WORTH THE HYPE they literally hover around you to grab ur plates before you re even done with your last bite. They all seem rushing to get you through and out. Even when ur plate clearly has food on it, god forbid you pause to chat they come and try and take it. It s really anxiety provoking. And it s absolutely freezing inside The ambiance was really nice and the food and salad was good.

Nice concept as there is only one menu and a cart with several desserts you can choose from. Obviously you have 1 salad, a skirt steak and as much fries as you want. They come after the meal to present you the desserts. There s also a choice of drinks and I tried the Strawberry lemonade and the Watermelon. I ve seen comments about the long lines and it kept me away from going    and we walked by a Friday at 2pm and had a table right away ! We had a good time and enjoyed our meal. Desserts are so good !!!!

Hostess tried to make me wait outside midday in summer for my dinning companion to arrive for lunch (restaurant was a 1/3 full). After objecting and getting inside, I tried to wait at the bar to get a drink and was told I could not.  The bar seats were for dinning guests that may come in . Again, restaurant was mostly empty. So Bizarre. Had me stand next to her at door. Companion arrives, we sit down, order, GIANT BUG IN SALAD. SO. GROSS. Not a fly nor nat; this was a big winged beetle. Clearly lettuce is not properly washed here. No thank you on a replacement salad Server was gracious, totally not their fault. But manager never came over to apologize or ask how to make it right. Strange for a well established restaurant group. Manhattan cocktail served warm. They brought an ice cube over as the supposed solve. Garlic bread overpriced (same as the table bread then overcooked crunchy with bit of herb/garlic). Steak: 1 medium and 1 rare served the same temp, couldn t tell the difference. PS they charge for extra sauce; Le Relais de lEntrecot is happy to pour it on. Additional fries not offered until steak was finished. No thanks. Poor imitation nock off with unfinished plywood walls in an attempt to be trendy? Hard pass. Dinner beware.

We waited in line for about 2 hours.  We were seated and the service was fast.  Very fast which is not what you want when you go for dinner and felt rushed.  As there really is no menu you get your salad served immediately and steak comes a few minutes later.  Steak was good and portion was OK leaving you wanting more.  The fries are endless and nice and crispy but we did have to flag people down to get more instead of having the staff looking who wanted more.  Dessert is a cart which is not included in price and changes fast so if you see something you like get it as they may run out by the end of your dinner. I would go back as it was a nice quick bite and this is how this is designed.  This is not a full menu restaurant and we knew that going there so were not disappointed.
I highly recommend. Delicious steaks and good drinks.
review_translated_text: Bardzo polecam. Wy mienite steki i dobre drinki.

review_text: Sooo good! Was skeptical but sooo tasty. Nice wines too.
Great steak! Cooked to perfection. Service is fast and kind. The unlimited fries are too good. Great value for your money. Will definitely be back again.
Waited in line for about an hour. The food was sub par. Lacked seasoning. The fries were extra crispy/burnt. Wait staff was not attentive.
Amazingly simple and delicious menu!  Never disappoints!  Steak salad and bottomless fries!! Dessert options are irresistible! Terrific friendly staff!  Do not miss!!

Was a line when my wife and I arrived. The wait wasn t to crazy, the host asked if we wanted to sit at the bar? Yea we had no problem with that. Got in there was a menu  but, not really a menu. The bartender asked what we were having and we weren t sure how to answer. He said everyone gets the same thing the $30 steak and whatever else comes with it. So that s what we ordered. I did have the watermelon shrub. Which was amazing( non-alcoholic) and the strawberry shrub(also amazing) but prefer the watermelon. The salad came first and it wasn t good to me. I don t really like vinaigrette. So yea.. the  guy brought out the steak and fries. Filled my plate with fries, which also wasn t good to me. I get that the fries are unlimited but yo  they are over cooked he didn t need to pile them on my plate like that and I kinda was hinting it was enough the first moment he started. The steak was cool. They only cook steak three ways. Rare, medium, and well. We got ours medium. It was cooked good but wasn t to crazy about it. I could cook some better steak than that. It d definitely taste better too!
Sorely disappointed at an extremely lackluster experience. Food, drink selection, and service were well below expectations here. It wasnt even good enough to sit here and warn you against a visit.
Pretty damn good. Wine was just average.

Truly this place was subpar, steak was good but the fries were not good. Everything was overpriced, and unfortunately I had wine spilled all over me. Customer service was terrible. They charged us for a bottle of Rose when we only got a cup.

Service was good, the meat was burned except for a few pieces which were really good but the rest wasn t and the drinks were good. I m going to give it another try but I hope they don t burn my meat next time.

The Ambiance of the place was inviting warm dim lights. The salad was fine the house bread was a little tough and the skirt steak was delicious and tender. The fries were crispy and well salted. We had a nice dinner. And the staff were nice and friendly! I recommend you try it out

The steak and fries were pretty good! But our waitress was a bit deceitful in the sides being extra, it seemed like it was part of the fixed menu so we were a bit surprised when the bill came. Other than that it was good!
I dont believe it was worth the wait on line and the $30.00  meal isnt worth the price!
Good stuff.
Best steak in town!

When you know what youre good at, do it to the best of your ability. I will note that the wagyu option is a bit heavy on the char taste but that might work for people with the creamier texture and flavor of the cut. Bigger fan of the regular skirt Steak option, but everything was delicious.
Great spot for the money. Steak was good, better than one youd take at chain restaurants such as Longhorn or Outback. Given the location, its impressive that they keep it st $30 with unlimited fries.
Fantastic. Skirt steak, unlimited ff and bread- 30$. There were some amazing sides- fresh tomato and onion salad, grilled zucchini, and cheesy potatoes. Totally worth a trip.
Great prefix menu with good unique desserts

For 30 dollars you get a salad and unlimited fries and a good portion steak. I personally need a medium rare but they only offer medium or rare. We tried both and I personally liked the medium more as compared to the well. But the well is still pink enough. Steak was well seasoned, fries delicious, and its a nice place for a casual dinner.
After half an hour of waiting we finally managed to eat at this restaurant. Very good skirt and excellent all you can fries formula.
review_translated_text: Dopo una mezzoretta di attesa siamo finalmente riusciti a mangiare in questo ristorante. Skirt molto buona e ottima la formula all you can fries.

review_text: My skirt steak was exactly how I like it medium ! Skirt steak offers a nice plain simple menu right to the point and your food is piping hot. Great spot for the price. Also unlimited french fries were pretty good.

Skirt steak with salad and unlimited fries for $30 (It was $28 before) is really good deal. You can choose meats  temperature. If you get dried and old fries, you can ask new fresh fries. One of our friends received totally overcooked meat even though we ordered medium rare, so we had to wait for new steak but we got it later at least. It wasn t busy night but our server forgot our garlic bread until the end and a staff totally forgot birthday candles for two friends  birthday cakes even though he said he has it. The person who brought the dessert cart was busy selling desserts and was not interested in the birthday candles. It would be better if the service was a little bit better, but for the price, I have no complaints.
Overhyped and greasy. no menu option for vegan so the vegan in the party only had wine. Personally not a fan of the oily salad or not crispy fries. Services and desert were good though.

If you do one thing well, no need to do anything else! Skirt steak was on point! It looks like a 6oz portion. Wish you could pay another $10 for a second portion of the delicious steak! Still great plus you have unlimited fries!
Unlimited Fresh cooked fries are great.
Worst burger I ever had

$30 for skirt steak, salad and unlimited fries. It s a good deal, and the steak is tasty. They have a wide range of desserts available on a cart that circulates through the restaurant. It became popular because of Tik tok but the hype has calmed and the line is reasonable now

Not impressed. My girl saw this on TikTok a while ago so we had to come here. The line outside is a fake hype, like when you re in line tryna pay a cover for the club and the bouncer won t let you take a peak because is empty inside. The food is mid. The price went $2 dollars up from earlier this year. They won t pass around that much offering you the free hard to chew fries, and the desert cart is a vibe but is too pricy for what quality of desert you re getting. Wake up. It really is not worth it. And the inside is cool, but let s be honest, it is cheap to make. Don t reply to this.
The steak was burnt on both sides and rare on the inside. This was also the case for 2 other guests next to us.

FABULOUS! Skirt Steak was WONDERFUL! From the moment we arrived to the last morsel of the deliciousness of food everything was Great! It felt as though we were at home with Family! Everyone was kind and went above and beyond to assure that we were well taken care of...And then the FOOOOOD! The Garlic Bread is NOT to be missed! Lorrrrd the Skirt Steak!!! No steak sauce ..NOTHING Needed! Unlimited French Fries!!!!! Lorrrrd make room for Dessert!!! Housemade with Love! Pure Delicious!!!! Thank youuuuu Skirt Steak for an unforgettable meal! Kyle! Thank you! A wonderful Surprise! You simply came over to make sure we were good and  became the icing on this beautiful Skirt Steak  cake! Thank You to alllllll of the hard dedicated staff who keep this smooth operation running!

Staff was rude and kept coming to our table with things we didn t asked or paid for. When the bill came out- my partner and I gave a low tip because of it and then they charged 20 more dollars to our bill. Also steak is way overpriced. A standard steak place will charge you about 20 bucks for a 6 oz and 2 well made sides. This placed charged us 33 for a six ounce and fries that looked like they were taken from mcdolnalds. Steak definitely didn t deserve the 33 dollar charge and staff needs more training on listening to their customers. Very unhappy!!!

Really good time. I knew going what to expect, and Skirt Steak did not disappoint. The line wasnt as bad as expected (they dont accept reservations) , we went during dinner time 6:30,7 pm and waited only 15, 20 minutes. We decided to sit at the bar.The Skirt steak was on point. I had mine rare and my girlfriend had hers medium.  Both came out perfect, with so much flavor.  The fries were some of the best fries I ever had. The bartender J. Was super nice. And we loved when we asked fro dessert,  they came with a lovely dessert cart. Hey 30$for a really good steak ,nice salad, and unlimited great fries in NYC! Cant beat that.

NOT WORTH THE HYPE. Stood in line for over an hour & were extremely disappointed at the underwhelming steak. First we chose the garlic bread & we re served salad. Following that we placed our order for our steak. Portions were VERY SMALL for meat (pictures showing trays of meat show portions for two people. Half of that is for one person) & drink were terrible. Total for two people + two drinks + two desserts = $141.51 + tip. Only up side was the dessert cart & the peas.

Hubby took me here. It was ok! Very strict menu and the drinks are very expensive. I would not drink here. They are very in and out here. Steak was good. Fries are horrible. Overcooked. Wine is meh! Wasnt horrible, but nothing to rave about. Get a happy hour and more sides to improve the experience. Deserts looked good but did not try any.
Good.
Great little place to eat they have no menu except beer and wine. They only serve salad, skirt steak and unlimited fries.The steak was tender fries was good also. They have a dessert cart...

We had heard this popular restaurant was good and arrived to join a queue waiting for a dinner table. Our party of 5 was plucked from the line ahead of other couples and we were seated inside. They showed a preference for bigger parties and the restaurant was busy. Efficient service with a good range of drinks. We had cocktails & beers, all were excellent. We ordered some sides with our steaks but they never arrived, the steaks an adequate size and were tender and tasty. The desert trolley rolled around and offered a good selection and we all enjoyed our choices. The only issue with our visit was that we were overcharged on the bill when it was entered by  our server after we left. It was noticed a few days later on our credit card statement and after 2 emails was corrected with an apology by the restaurant. Worth a visit to this reasonably priced restaurant with a never ending serve of fries! Please note that once you have finished your meal you are reminded that you need to leave.
Went on Father s Day for dinner, so expected it to be busy. The wait was not bad at all, and was totally worth it as the meal was fantastic! We will be back! Keep up the good work!
Yet another awesome spot downtown NY..great vibe and good food. Check it out!!
I had a great time here. The service was good  no complaints. I love you get to see all the deserts in front of you before you order. The place was definitely clean which is a plus for me.
Excellent steak and fries. Everything else is pricey.

I love the simplicity of the menu and only having to choose how I want my meat cooked. And everything tasted wonderful! The bar staff was cordial, but the host staff was slammed and not very friendly.
Nice, intimate place to come with friends or a partner. Steak was great so were the fries. Salad was ehh. But that s all you can get here besides dessert.
Good place, the stake not that good, but for its price seems good to give it a try.

The two reasons ppl come here are the steaks and unlimited fries. Both were disappointing. Steak tasted like they were dragged through a sand of salt, no other flavors hit your taste buds. (The homemade sauce tasted like a watered-down ranch dressing) Biggest let down is they dont even give you a full sized serving of a steak. They give you chopped up small 6 peices. The fries? Dipped and drenched in a bucket of oil and salt, dont joke about it being average size either. Well below average in quality. We ordered the truffle fries. They were basically regular fries with sprinkles of whatever the heck they added on it that tasted like more salt. Bottomless bucket is an illusionary market tactic, non of us got a second serving. Because why? Salty, oily, flavorless, and your conscious will hit you too if youre health consciousness. The good? Bartender made strong drinks. The desserts were phenomenal.
Never been inside but the smell of burnt oil this place emanates is disturbing and the crowd outside makes it difficult to walk by it. Hope this place closes soon

We absolutely loved Skirt Steak and met a very nice Canadian couple and we spent the whole night talking with them. Its a must visit restaurant, just be aware that queues can be very long. Also, if they ask if you want to eat or have drinks at the bar, we actually found going as a couple it can be nicer going to the bar as its a good atmosphere. In total, we found it very nice but also extremely expensive. Wheelchair accessibility: You can enter without issues if you have a wheelchair.

Enjoyed the great customer service asc week as the food.  Eddie our waiter was so proficient, professional & warm.  Loved the unlimited French fries.  I like how they slice the skirt steak. And the garlic bread, oh my! The salad was great.  I will be back! Kid-friendliness: Kids will    the endless fries.

I always wanted to come to this place!Anytime I passed by there was a long line of people waiting to get in, so I always thought this place must be great. People were talking about this place in social media too., today I was near by and I decided to try it out for lunch,  I had the steak of course, the salad was very oily, I bit bitter for my taste and since I don t like oily things I asked the bartender to take it out from the table, I just had to bites of it ,  then the steak and fries came to the table, the steak was just ok, the fries were kinda cold,  and overcooked, I can tell even Mac Donald s fries are better, I didn t finish the fries, they never checked if everything was good, not even with the salad, and obviously the fries, i know great customer service  it was just a subpar experience!! I guess my expectations were higher!!

The steak is good and petite. The salad is just greens and the dressing is bitter. The fries are good and the Spritzer is light, fruity and perfect. Its a filling meal, dim atmosphere and not a long wait for your food. The line to get in seems by design rather than a packed house. You can not beat it for $30
Great bang for your buck! Tasty cocktails
Great deal, meat needs salt. Gorgeous, spartan room. Not really worth the long wait.  If you can get a table quickly, then try it
The skirt steak  is nice the line is kinda long  but hey its worth it.

This is a great concept and business model, but the food was just fine. The steak was pretty bland considering it was the main event and I don t think worth waiting hours for in line. The fries were pretty good and honestly I think my favorite thing was the salad. Super refreshing. Overall the food is not bad but I wouldn t wait in line for it again.

I always see a line of people waiting to get in so I thought I would check it out. Menu is simple, steak or burger. I went with the basics because the extrad were pretty expensive. Steak was good though I needed to send it back because I asked for medium and it was rare. Nice fresh salad with a delicious dressing. Fries are unlimited and even though I didnt want a massive amount, the server insisted on giving me more. They have a nice looking desert cart but desert was too much for me. Overall, not bad

Stay in NY 2nd half of May Waiting for an hour is not a French tradition, especially when you see many tables not cleared and waiters who seem idle. Once seated, we fortunately had a server of South/American origin who was very friendly compared to the first waitress who made no effort to make herself understood The meat and fries are ok...the salad tasteless... Restaurant that needs to improve on 2 points, the service and the queue
review_translated_text: Sejour a NY 2 eme quinzaine de mai L attente d une heure n est pas dans la tradition francaise surtout quand on voit de nombreuses tables non debarrassees et des serveurs qui semblent des uvres. Une fois installes, Nous avons eu heureusement un serveur d origine sud/americaine qui a ete tres sympathique au regard de la 1ere serveuse qui ne faisait aucun effort pour se faire comprendre La viande et les frites sont corrects la salade sans saveur Restaurant qui doit s ameliorer sur 2 points, le service et la file d attente

review_text: Great vibe and food however the server was not the best. stood in like for 40+min which was worth it because the meal is honestly great and delicious however to get treated the way we did was unacceptable.

One Menu option....skirt steak, and they do it very well! $28 prix fixe menu starts with a lightly dressed green salad and warm bread for table. Garlic bread is available for $10. Waiter will then explain their steak is cooked either three ways Med, Med Rare, Rare. Steak comes out hot and accompanied with a  house made sauce similar to Au Piovre. Fries are unlimited and are piled high once the steak reaches the table. Ketchup, Mayo, and Mustard are your three condiment choices. Additional sides are available for $10 each. Drinks were decent I did the spiced margarita . Once entree is finished dessert is offered via a cart at $10. After filling up with Steak and Fries I had to pass on dessert.  Over all great experience. Reservations are not accepted so be prepared to wait as there is always a line down the block. I suggest arriving around 430pm as they open at 5pm for first seating.

This restaurant does not accept reservations for small groups, so when my boyfriend got there around 5:20 pm there was already a line out the door. A plain flank steak costs $28, which is a bargain in New York City, which is probably why people were willing to wait for a table. Luckily, our total time waiting in line was about 15 minutes because we volunteered for the seats at the bar. The menus are quite simple. You order the steak and they give you unlimited salad and fries. Optionally, you can order other side dishes such as fries or spinach. We ordered a regular flank steak ($28) and the Wagyu ($56) for both of us. This restaurant doesn t take reservations for small parties, when my partner arrived there around 5:20 PM there was already a line out of the door. The regular skirt steak was for $28, this is a bargain in NYC, and its likely why people are willing to wait. Fortunately the total wait time was about 15 minutes in line because we volunteered for bar seats. The menus are pretty straight forward. You order steak, and they give you a salad and unlimited fries. You can optionally order other daily sides such as fingerling potatoes or spinach. We ordered a regular skirt steak ($28) and the wagyu ($56) for the two of us.
