review_text: Didn t have a great experience  but haven t totally written them off! The reviews were raving, so the demand was high. Waited an unreasonable amount of time in the cold for entry, for a great $28 steak and fries deal. No coke for my daughter, eager waiter sent someone to the store! Nice but he got diet, with what the response  you looked like a diet girl  whaaaa? Nope. Ordered coke! The cocktail I ordered  got report back like 10 minutes later, bar didn t have the ingredients to make  you have the ability to upgrade bread to a buttery garlicky version  they didn t have  you have the ability to add on scrumptious sides from a feature list (I think it may change seasonally) doesn t matter, they ran out! Not to mention the meal was just okay. Fries were definitely on point, but I may have had a general taste of disgust from the disappointment in my mouth. I d be willing to chalk it up as a bad night  maybe give it a go during a less busy time. But for now just okay at best was my experience  Waiter while eager to please, was a bit of a bug, and then MIA when we needed/wanted him. Again I may have been too annoyed to appreciate anything! The dessert truck was a really neat and exciting treat when it came rolling around to us  too bad they didn t have what were hoping to order. Bummer.
The salad  was bitter but the steak  and the garlic bread   was really  good. The line was long  so get there early

very mediocre at best  if you have the option for brunch, get the burger instead. it was much better than the steak. the steak itself was fine, but not high quality beef and nothing special. the salad was actually shockingly the best thing we had. the garlic bread was good, but you can t mess up bread baked with oil  it was also an additional $10. while this is definitely a value play, i wouldn t pay for this again  i d rather pay more for better steak. also i definitely would NOT wait in line for this  get a reservation or go for brunch.
Great steak! Not my favorite fries, but good place!

I came here last night for dinner since it was the first time the line wasn t crazy long. I ve seen it hyped up on social media and have been wanting to try it. The service was great. The salad had something extremely bitter in it that me and my partner couldn t even finish it. I ordered the steak medium and it was crazy chewy. Then the desserts came around in a cart and looked beautiful. The key lime pie was great as for the flan it has some sort of a butterscotch topping which made it almost made it inedible  because it was wild sweet. I m not sure why someone would add that to a flan since it s already super sweet. As for drinks I had the spritzer and that was great. The prices were fair but I m a foodie and this was pretty subpar for what I was expecting.

When we arrived there was already a line out the door so we knew it had to be doing something right. Our server was extremely kind and helpful, but the runners seemed confused as to what they were doing, even coming around our table with our sides and shouted f*** and left without an explanation. The food was overall fine. The fries were by far the best part - in fact they were really good, but they never came by with a refill as they said they would. The steak was fine. The salad would have been good, but the salad dressing felt grainy for some reason? It also needs to be said that it felt like there was a very large charge for everything. No drinks were free, including water - 12 dollars for a liter bottle. A side of tator tots was 10 dollars. Getting your complimentary bread upgraded to garlic bread was 10 dollars... there seemed to be a way of upgrading everything. Overall it was a fine experience, but I personally think there are better places in the city to spend your money.
Great ! Delicious steak and great atmosphere. Thank you Vanessa, the bartender, for delicious cocktails !

Good concept that works. A baguette, a salad, a good steak and unlimited fries for a very reasonable price of 28 dollars per person. The steak is well seasoned and the fries are also tasty. Good and fast service. Delicious desserts from the dessert cart that comes to your table. There is often a line outside, but we were able to get a table right away.
review_translated_text: Goed concept wat werkt. Een stokbroodje, een salade, een goede biefstuk en onbeperkte frietjes voor een hele schappelijke prijs van 28 dollar per persoon. De biefstuk is goed gekruid en ook de frietjes zijn lekker. Goede en snelle service. Lekkere toetjes van de dessertkar  die bij je tafel komt. Er staat vaak een rij buiten, maar wij konden gelijk aan tafel.

review_text: Good but food is a bit salty

DISAPPOINTING! I was looking forward to eat at this restaurant because their publicity and photos were amazing. We got an indoor table which was nice but now the problems start: 4 people at a table and they only sent a basket with 1 bread, the same amount they send for a table with 1 or 2 people, and when we asked for more the waiter said it would be extra $4 it didnt make sense! According to the amount of meat was less than what they advertise, I ordered it well done and it came burnt, the potatoes were burnt too. The waiter almost didnt come to the table and when we asked for the bill he took exactly 30 minutes to collect and whenever he was going to leave something on the table he literally threw it and left. I dont recommend it and it was a terrible experience!
Excellent food, excellent service,  reasonably priced , an all round perfect experience and I would highly recommend a meal there
Great vibes
Very nice for the price! The staff was kind. My cocktail was delicious. There was no wait and I arrived about 12:15 on a weekday.
Very good meat restaurant with a unique dish for everyone: salad, fries and skirt steak for $28 which is very reasonable in NY. Plus the meat is really good and the service is top notch.
Worth the wait in line!!!
Food was average. Steak was okay. Fries was were a bit burnt and tasted like it was refried. Don t try everything that looks cool on TikTok. Lesson learned
Nice place simple menu delicious steak

Great! The main highlight of this place is the cheap price and the free fries refill. Only drawback is that there is no reservations and the long line during opening. If you are unlucky, you might wait up to an hour.
I came after the hype died down so the wait wasn t that long, better that it s not as cold. Amazing steak and sides, no gray band and cooked to perfection, and crisp spring vegetables.

Even though the line was huge I was waiting for 20-25 min probably. The food was tasty, the service - was quite nice, and the restrooms clean. I wish the steak portion to be more but for $28 with a salad and unlimited fries, its acceptable. Total check if you add only a drink will be $50-55 per person as $28 is a net price for the fixed stake menu + $ 10 for beer or $15 for a glass of wine + tax + 20% tips
Great food, excellent service, loooooooooooong line

Not really worth the detour. Fries are way too salty and honestly not that great. The steak is small (not unlimited) with only 3 temperature for serving. I had medium which was close to being overcooked. It had a cool concept as a restaurant but really rested on their early success and dropped the ball on quality. Not worth the wait. Service and staff was great
Great concept! Quick and easy to order!  Great service and great food!

I went here because of IG ... Took me 4 days to write this review &I REALLY wanted to love this place  even after reading the reviews regarding the line outside to get in still wanted to Love it and had high hopes , but to actually experience an almost 3 hr wait on line outiside its DEFINITELY NOT worth it.I had to rest and sleep the entire next day just to recoup from standing outside ...The steak is pretty straight foward nothing special in flavor, the fries were over cooked resembled crunchy fried potatoes sticks and not actually fries, The house salad can use something extra , my son asked for a sprite, am guessing it was from a fountain machine the soda was as flat as can be , and when brought up to the waiter hes reaction was like  oh yea, sorry like he knew it was flat and served it anyways, we asked if perhaps they had canned soda which they didnt, The Garlic bread,blackberry spritz & dessert cart was the best part I had the strawberry tart with lime zest .. taste just like summer... but besides that if your looking for good steak save yourself the trouble and go to a real steak house and yes $28 seems like a great deal but I wouldnt visit a 2nd time as my first was definitely an experience but I rather pay more at a real steakhouse .. IG failed me on this one.

The experience was absolutely bad. The servers were rude. We ordered one offer ( steak + salad + fries) and one steak. He told us that if we ordered steak without the full offer we will be not allowed to share fries and salad!! We said ok. When I started to eat the salad they kept looking and staring at us to check if my wife ate from the salad or not!!! When the other server served the fried he put for both of us ( we told him that we ordered one only ) immediately after that the first server came and said you ordered one fries only with an impolite way .. we told him it s not our fault and we told him that we ordered one. At the end when we saw the check they charged us full price for 2 orders. ( this is a ripoff) I spoke with the manager and then he modified the check. Again, we were extremely disappointed.

It s a great place to hang out with your friends and enjoy the food. The wait hour for us was about an hour. Reservations are only for parties of 7 or more. We ordered rare and medium and both of them were perfectly cooked. They also provide unlimited french fries! At the end of the meal, you could also selected your deserts from the cart. I recommend their strawberry tart because the strawberries didn t taste sour at all when I tried it.

Finally got a table without waiting for hours. And it was a beautiful evening so got to eat outside too! The salad was good, very simple. The steak was delicious and perfectly cooked medium! The service was so nice and polite and attentive. I am definitely coming back. Save room for dessert!
What a great place. A scrummy steak for a good price. There is only one thing on the menu and only a couple of sides. Had to queue for about 30mins, but it was warm and dry outside, so no drama!
It would be nice to know beforehand that the iced tea is unsweetened
AMAZING !!!!!!!!! DELICIOUS!!!!!! WILL BE BACK

1 hour wait but the steak was great! But unfortunately we couldnt do sharing and each person had to order a steak prix fix or a la carte which was difficult forr kids when they didnt have burgers for dinner hours. The steak was perfectly seasoned and the fries were good.  The dessert was really fresh and great like they said.

Not a fan of the waiting system outside on a line. Cool concept but as steak lover the steak portion wasnt enough (you get what you pay for), fries were nice & crispy. I suggest adding garlic bread or dinner rolls to the $28 package deal instead of extra cost.

This was such a waste of $28 OK OK the steak was fine it was small maybe 6 oz then they give you the skinny funky fries that are overcooked and greasy then they call this salad when its just lettuce just a bunch of lettuce not even cut up and it has a slight vinegar it thats OK but taste like  Licorice more than anything else the garlic bread that costs $10 is just the same bread thats on the table with the pesto butter on it This place is so overrated one good thing about it was the cauliflower steak my daughter enjoyed it tremendously

We came here for lunch, it wasnt busy at that time, but we sat for 4 minutes and no one came forward to take care of us, not even water. Maybe I am not a handsome guy. The steak is good, the fries are great. And a cool ambiance.
OMG the food is to die for....
Excellent price/quality ratio. Too bad its always packed and you have to wait a long time to find an available table, but its worth it

Overall it was a great experience. We stayed on the line for about 30 minutes and the hostess came up to us offering the seats by the bar. The salad was good as well as the fries, and the steak was okay, it was a very small portion but the experience was good. I would recommend this place and i think i m gonna order a steak for 58$ next time.

Restaurant with a unique menu. We went there for lunch, we didnt have to queue and the service was pretty quick. The concept is quite nice, the meat is good and cooked correctly. The fries are pretty good and unlimited. To end on a sweet note, a dessert trolley is offered. There are a multitude of cakes on offer and generously. In short, the quality/price ratio is good and you will not be disappointed!
review_translated_text: Restaurant au menu unique. Nous y sommes alles pour le dejeuner, nous navons pas eu a faire la queue et le service etait assez rapide. Le concept est assez sympa, la viande est bonne et cuite correctement. Les frites sont plutot pas mal et a volontes. Pour finir sur une note sucree, un chariot a dessert est propose. Il y a une multitude de gateaux propose et ce de maniere genereuse. Bref le rapport qualite/prix est bon et vous ne serez pas decus !

review_text: Delicious steak cook very well very friendly service staff are nice and very helpful food priced right $$ yes there is wait but should effect their review Definitely will come back
Everything was so delicious!
The wait was almost 2 hrs but the food then was good. Would go again if there is not such a long wait.
Decent quality  skirt steak .  Fries were good, mostly salty on flavors but it s not bad for the value.

Prix fix menu, unlimited fries and steak for $28,- But it s always either well done, medium or rare nothing in between. Because it s busy I guess. It s OK nothing special. Feels like comfort food steak place. Good range of desserts but we were full, lol.

COMPLETE HYPE I ordered a skirt steak and a  wagyu   skirt steak. Let s say, I could believe they sent me the same basic skirt steak as it was no different. As some one who eats wagyu, I was very disappointed. The salad pieces were larger then my face. Like why? Also either they put a seasoning in it or they don t wash it properly as I was crunching on what looked and seemed like dirt. The only thing that was very good was the potato with cheese and bacon. Other then that, spending $175 I d rather cook food at home and make a better steak or go to a few different locations.

Oh my goodness. My stomach has never felt this crazy before. Steak was charred, burnt, like the other reviews mentioned, needed salt & pepper. It was hard to swallow. The thick sauce definitely helped to add flavor.Salad was decent. The fries could ve been better. More than 90% the fries were extra crispy and simply crumbs ,Like the left over fries you don t eat. You will end up leaving hungry unless you order 2 orders of steak for one person. Or you will end up leaving with your stomach feeling inside out. Might as well go to Applebees,Not worth the hype. But was it all worth it at the end with the service, food, how you feel after leaving. Na I don t think so. I also observed some unusual behavior with staff . A man was staring at my child up and down as we were leaving . Disgusting

Having a set menu is such an ingenious idea that works so well at Skirt Steak. Thankfully we got there, right when there was no line and got sat at the bar. The salad wasnt much to my liking but come on I didnt come here for the salad. The steak was cooked perfectly and the fries were amazing. The side menu was small but what I got off it was very good. Wish I got a dessert too, they looked amazing.

I went on a Monday around noon, the wait was about 30 mins. Honestly the only good thing about this place is the concept. Only one main entree which is steak. You get a green salad which is just lettuce no toppings, mixed in their dressing. No option for another. The steak was a little burnt which gave it that burnt taste. No good. It was also chewy. The fries looked soggy but they were pretty good. We also got one side order of the potatoes with cheese and bacon. The potatoes were hard. But the cheese was amazing. For drink, I got the blueberry spritz, that was delicious. As for service, they did come around a few times but forgot our silverware which didn t come until after we received our food. And the food took about 30 mins to come out which I thought was crazy since there s only one thing in the menu. Not a place I will be going back to.
Good promotion at lunch, meat
review_translated_text: Buena promocion en el almuerzo, de carne

review_text: Didnt stand in line for too long, but seems to be quite busy. Love the concept, easy to order - salad, steak and fries is the only thing on the menu. Get the garlic bread, which was freshly made!

Love the experience, the wait in line is over an hour but once we got inside the wait staff was accommodating and friendly. The meal is steak brought to your table your choice of rear, medium rear and well done with refill of unlimited hot crispy fries. We ordered the garlic bread really tasty but a little hard and could bruise your gums. The added bonus is that the meal is $28.00 per person and could be more once you add starters, drinks and dessert.

Being A Steak Lover I Give this Please 5 Stars... The Skirt Steak with Fried Eggs and  Garlic bread and Salad was Delicious...If you dont have  Patience this places is not  for you Stay Home,  Get Ready to Stay on Line for couple Minutes  Pending on the Day and time Great STAFF GREAT  Atmosphere.
Wish the salad was an actual salad with at least one additional veggie aside from lettuce

The ambiance of this place is nice. The staff are great!!! They are so courteous,pleasant and polite! Everyone is so zen!! spirited!!. The management is doing a great job with this place keep it up!! Thank cat!,Melissa, and Kiril for showing us great hospitality!!

Surprisingly, the wait wasn t too long. My friends and I arrived before more people joined the line and it was pretty much down the block. The wait was about 30 mins and we were finally seated. I would love to speak on the service It was great! The overall staff  are friendly and pleasant. They re not overbearing or inauthentic at all. We had the pleasure of being served by Kat, who was a complete doll. Another server by the name of Melissa came to check on us as well and she was quite pleasant as well. The food was delicious! It was well worth the $28 dollars to me. The steak was delicious, the fries were good and the garlic bread was satisfying. The only thing I wish this place would do is allow reservations for smaller parties because the waiting can be a bit draining, but I m thankful that we didn t wait long! I definitely recommend this place!

Beautiful place and unexpectedly the salad was the winner! Steak was good, wasnt crazy about the peppercorn sauce. Fries were great. Gotta try the blood orange spice beverage also. The salad is bibb lettuce, endive with a sherry and shallot vinaigrette... so flavorful. Wish we couldve had dessert but everything had nuts. We got there 20 mins before opening and didnt have to wait long.

Enjoyed the experience at Skirt Steak. We went right when they opened during lunch, and we beat the crowd. They do one thing, and they do it well   the skirt steak was delicious. The fries are those skinny fries that were cooked to perfect crispness with just the right amount of salt. I ate more of those than planned! We tried an upgraded bread for the table ($10, garlic bread), and in the future, we d skip that option. Not because it wasn t tasty, because it was, but because with that plus the small starter salad (simple, with a nice, light dressing) and the main course, it was quite a bit of food (ended up bringing the remainder of my steak home). Would definitely go again.
Great quality and price. Wait is worth 20-30 min max. So about 30 people.

Id rate 4 star if we hadnt waited for 1.5 hrs. Actually, the long line of people waiting to dine in is the most prominent feature of this restaurant and I myself had been wondering what is there that keeps people waiting for so long. Now, I can say its not worth the wait. Steak itself was not tender, however the waitress offered a better cut at 2x price, but we went on with regular one that comes with fries and salad at $28. Salad was good but fries were too oily and not crunchy. Food and wait aside, the staff were so friendly and they provided a really nice service.

Amazing!!!! The price was perfect and the food cant be beat. The steaks were tender end cooked well and the fries were seasoned to perfection!!! All the staff were so nice and welcoming. They dont do reservations for parties under 7 so get there early because there was a long line.
Absolutely fantastic.

Ok found this place while walking to Penn station.  Reservations are recommended but we walked in and were seated all within 5 minutes of arrival. It was a Wednesday night after 9:30pm. Tom, our waiter was super awesome, attentive yet not overbearing. We ordered prefix steak option ($28 per person). I selected French fries which were delicious. Atmosphere was busy but not loud. Restrooms are decently cleaned especially at the time we arrived.

This place is amazing. The simplicity of it means what they do is almost perfect. Steak is amazing. Recommend the garlic bread. Honestly don t recommend the wagu upgrade if offered. The regular steak is better. Manhattans here are top notch.
Cooked To Perfection!!! Garlic Bread Was  Delicious!!! The 3 Hour Wait Was Worth It!!

Delicious! Simple restaurant design allows you to focus on the food! The steak is the star of the show buttery and flavorful! The salad and fries are also delicious. The portions are just right. Their sides are also recommended. The califlower augrautin is a must have. The drinks were also good. Great value and service!
Long wait on the line to get in. Fries and steak were delicious but the steak portion seemed small to me.

Food & drinks delicious. Our experience IN the restaurant was awesome, service was excellent. I have nothing negative to say about the restaurant in general .BUT, be prepared for the long wait. We waited exactly 2 hours in line (5:30pm-7:30pm), we skipped like 20 minutes when host came outside asking for 2 bar seating otherwise it could ve been more than 2 hours, also it was Saturday afternoon. Worth the wait, YES , but I wouldn t do it again

I felt like I was pregnant and the baby was being delivered in 30 minutes the way the wanted to push me out. And my bill was 200 dollars expensive AF the food was Overrated extremely Overrated. Dont even waste ya time NOT WORTH THE HYPE...

Love the simplicity of the menu. Greens, skirt steak, and unlimited fries for lunch. Also the option for dessert via a cart! Lunch time is easier to get a table. Dinner may have more problems. No issues for Sunday Lunch.

We(2)waited about 1.5 hrs to be seated. Dinner menu is straight forward - prefixed - bread n butter, salad, skirt steak cooked to your liking with house sauce on the side, and bangin bottomless fries...Steaks were perfectly cooked(medium), staff was nice and attentive. If in the area stop in, not sure if Id go out my way to eat here again.

Very good discovery! The meat is succulent and juicy! The main menu is $28 dollars including salad, steak and fries. I recommend this restaurant if you want to eat a good steak and fries in a friendly atmosphere! Little bonus: for big appetites, the fries are unlimited
review_translated_text: Tres bonne decouverte! La viande est succulente et juteuse! Le menu principal est a $28 dollars comprenant de la salade, du steak and des frites. Je vous recommande ce restaurant si vous voulez manger un bon steak frites dans une ambiance conviviale! Petit bonus: pour les gros appetits les frites sont a volontes

review_text: Don t believe the HYPE about the TIKTOK s. That $29 for everything is a LIE !!! Well you know what they say   you pay for what you get . The service is cheap. The lettuce is horrible cheap. The only thing that was good was the DESSERT. Every little thing you order will get you charged from the drinks to the side orders. Please look up before you go stand on in line for a hour for no reason. Good marketing Skirt Steak

I found this place on Yelp and had been to a place in London with the same concept, so I wanted to check it out. The menu only has one main item on it, which is steak. My friends and I came in at around 12 on a Saturday, as they do not accept reservations. We didnt have to wait but it was pretty packed at that time already. For drinks, I had the blackberry spritz, which wasnt bad. Fruity but not too sweet. The skirt steak ($28) comes with a side of au poivre (probably?) sauce, a salad, and unlimited fries. There are only three doneness options: well done, medium well, or rare. I usually get medium rare so I opted for the rare, which pretty much was like medium rare. The steak was pretty salty and chewy. It was kind of disappointing. The fries looked soggy but they actually taste better than it looks. The best part of the meal was probably the salad. Its a butter lettuce salad, though they were a bit heavy handed on the dressing. The steak looks small but I was struggling to finish towards the end, probably because 1. I ate a bunch of fries 2. Again, the steak was salty. Overall, it was okay for what it was but I probably wouldnt come back.

(Pros and Cons Below) Overall it was a good experience, if youre coming from Tik Tok expecting the world, it simply falls short... Cons: 1hr line minimum, small serving of steak, fries were okay Honestly food was pretty decent, steak was good not great imo. The pictures attached was for 2 servings. I was expecting more, but also understand considering the price. Fries were inconsistent, one batch was unsalted and I had to ask for salt, the next batch seemed to come from the depths of the ocean and I was shaking some off. Pros: Staff is very attentive and professional, has a real valuable steakhouse feel. Vibe is fun, people are in good spirits. Cant go wrong with $28 steak and fries. They dont let you go empty on the fries(in a nice way.) Staff is quick to grab empty plates and very friendly. Overall, I may have rated higher if I didnt go into it expecting more from all the hype build up and a 1hr+ long line. Just doesnt seem worth it for another visit.

Food is okay-steak cooked well and fries burnt. Waited an hour in line at 6pm for table of 2. Manager asked us if we re ok sitting at the bar. When we got inside saw a table for two open and asked if we could move. Man in front with long wavy hair was very rude and dismissive. Said once your at the bar you can t move to a table. No one mentioned this to us in line when asked if we wanted to sit at bar. I think because they have lines think it s ok to be rude to clients. Not worth being treated rudely in my mind-still $65 meal with drinks. Bartender was nice and food was decent. Not worth rude treatment by staff and manager so be warned.

Ambiance to top notch. Reserve a table so you dont wait for 40 mins on a line. Steak is good, but better with the burnaise sauce. Fries are top notch. 28 bucks a plate? Great for a date, terrible for a group outing, wallet wise.
Great Food and Experience

I was very excited to dine here. The reviews seemed great. First off, there is NO two hour wait. On Saturday and Sunday the restaurant opens for brunch (same menu, with the addition of garlic bread for $12, and no option for bottomless drinks). The hours on those days are 11:30a-3p and the reopen at 5pm until closing (10/11p). Therefore, people made it during 3-5p and decided themselves to wait. Moving on. This was my second time here because of that. Our table had bread crumbs on it and the paper placemats had an oil stain. The waitress dusted it off but we had to ask the bus boy to replace the paper. Underneath had more crumbs and dirt and he threw the new mat over it. Unacceptable. Next, we were told buy a manager there was no Prosecco but the waitress said there was. When it was brought to the table it was flatter than fast food soda. Unacceptable. The server really tries to upcharge by selling you on $10 sides. But the food comes with 2 sides- my personal opinion is just to offer substitutions or $1 upcharge to switch it because you still get the salad + fries + extra side(s). My biggest issue was that this restaurant use PEANUT OIL to fry their fries AND you dont know until you ask. In a world full of allergies this should be readily disclosed. Unacceptable. *Disclamer- all the desserts, with the exception of the Chocolate cake, are made with NUTS* The meat is served Med Rare, Medium, and Well Done. What also went wrong was that 4 orders of meat came out severely undercooked when we asked for Medium. At this point I was turned off and no longer hungry. Our waitress started off very friendly but soon didnt show up to our table at all. The manager Savaah stopped by the table was was extremely personable. He spoke with us a little and apologized for the experience and welcomed us to dine their again in hopes we would change our minds. Because of his visit to the table and his generous offers we reconsidered. However, after reviewing it with my party we probably will not, not based on the experience but based on the food quality itself. The portion size for one is a 4-6 oz steak, a licorice flavored salad, and cold + burnt fries. Savaah has increased my star review, and I sincerely thank you, but ultimately I would not recommend this restaurant. Pictures to follow.
It was good but portion was small. Table next to us had a full plate of salad. Fries were good. Nothing special. Social media is just powerful. Would I go again? Probably not.

Got here at 5pm, waited about 1 hours and 30 minutes to get seated. Honestly not worth the wait. It s decent deal, food was ok. If I was around the neighborhood and there was no line I might drop in. But I would never wait over 1hr and 30 mins again. I respect the instagram and tik tok hustle so 4 stars,and mimicking a long club line. But yeah no thanks .
there is a wait but so worth it! food was absolutely amazing the fries are soooo well seasoned! definitely going back but maybe earlier to wait less lol

Yea the wait is ridiculously long but once you get inside the service staff is efficient and fast. The food was delicious. Word of advice get there 30 mins before they open and skip the garlic bread. It s basic and not worth $10.
Wouldn t seat us inside of stated closing time. Complacency

disappointed bad service horrible food low quality meat i thought after two hours of waiting i thought i would be surprised by a quality steak just not low quality meat not to say the crests with a lot of horrible oil and the salad was the best for two hours waiting time food is not up to date owners need to understand Nyc

The steak pan is actually for two people not one. I paid SO much for VERY little food. My youngest child cooks way better than this. The wait time is also ridiculous ! Did I mention that I m still hungry?!
I love it. All the waiting in line to get in wealth it. Steak was excellent and the service was cool.

Food is definitely worth the price. All the employees I encountered were very friendly and professional. I would definitely go back if the wait wasn t so long. I m glad I went and ordered pretty much most of the menu. The drinks and dessert are also a must try! Honestly, I d go back for the dessert. For people wondering about the wait, especially in Manhattan around dinner time, my friends and I got seated after 2 hours of waiting on a Saturday. Which is average waiting for a place that doesn t do reservations.

The food here looks great, but was marred by bad cooking technique. The steak, while cooked perfectly rare with a nice char, had that nasty acrid flavor from using lighter fluid (or quick light charcoal) to speed up the process, instead of letting the charcoal burn properly until its ready. This flavor was very overpowering and really detracted from our enjoyment of the meal. The unlimited fries were very good, and the salad was better than we were expecting. My wifes $16 glass of Pinot Noir tasted awful, like a cheap $3 bottle. But my dirty martini was perfect. The garlic bread at a $10 upsell was super stale and hard, but thankfully the waitress took it off the bill when requested.
Great food

Really nice. Simple menu, additional sides, great drinks, yummy desert cart. I kind of wish the steak portion was a bit larger. I would have gladly gave up the unlimited fries for a bigger piece of steak. Features: Definitely not practicing covid space issues. Too close to each other for that. Sill liked it.
Good steak, great fries, amazing service! The line can be rough but its worth it. Will definitely go back.
Their menu is simple and perfection. Great date spot, affordable and delicious.
We waited in line for about an hour and 45 mins but it was so worth it the food was amazing and the atmosphere and service we just as amazing I will for sure come back every time I am in the city

Unfortunately this place is not quite worth the hype. 1.  The skirt steak:  you have ONE job, and it was kind of a mess.  Rare, medium and well are the only options.  We ordered 4 mediums and 1 rare, what we received was a hodge-podge of raw to medium-well, sometimes within one portion.  The waiter kindly offered to take some of the raw pieces back.  That sauce was tasty, and necessary to season the otherwise bland skirt steak. 2. The unlimited fries - so disappointing.  Overcooked and cold.  After the second refill of dry cold fries, we asked for a new batch, and the waiter finally brought us some hot fries. 3.  Dessert- key lime pie, with an unnecessary but,very dramatic looking, fluff tasting meringue was okay.  Thin slice of desserts not worth the $10 go to a local bakery instead. 4. Sides - never received the sides we ordered to yeah that happened. 5. Drinks - again save your money.  The non-alcoholic Cranberry Rosemary drink is simple syrup and seltzer with a tablespoon of cranberry juice. Another $10 wasted. 6.  Overall atmosphere- People literally kept their coats on because it was so cold.  Either this was done on purpose or a malfunctioning hvac system, either was it was horribly cold and drafty. The concept is great for marketing, but actual execution really missed the mark.  The waiters and staff are super friendly and pretty efficient considering the capacity crowd, but the kitchen is going to tank this place if they don t get the quality control together.

Really cant say enough about how good the food is at Skirt Steak. Yeah, its just steak and some sides but they do those things extremely well, unlike places that have a huge menu that dont do any well but instead the food is average. This food is AMAZING!! and the manager Savoth and our server Alexis GREAT!! they were very attentive. They could easily charge more than $28 for what you get and it would still be worth it.
Features: opens at 5pm..no reservations unless larger parties..see website....theres always a line..suggest to get there before 5 to get in earlier...I waited 1 hour Dine in: Yes Outdoor seating: No
review_translated_text: Dine in: Yes Outdoor seating: No

review_text: Great steak. Nice and simple place

We sat down and our waiter asked if we wanted garlic bread, after we said yes he then said it would be $10 and walked away before we could change our minds. Besides the fact it was a tiny loaf and not that good, we overheard the waiter at the table next to us say there was complimentary bread with butter or garlic bread. My party was totally outraged as our waiter took advantage of a group of young girls, he was not left a nice tip. Other than that, the  salad  was lettuce with dressing and the steak was pretty good. We will not be returning.

The steak was very good and pre cut which turned out to be very convenient. Served with pepper sauce. The salad was of different lettuces and tasty. Fries (with free unlimited refills) were good but too salty. The server promotes the additional selling of items like a spinach side, but these items do not show in the menu. The price of the spinach side was $10 before taxes and tips. Features: Didnt notice any special practices

Absolutely one of the best deals ever. The regular deal is $28 for salad, steak, and unlimited fries but for a $30 supplement you can get their wagyu which is, undoubtedly, the best for the price. They switch up their wagyu from day to day depending on the quality, sometimes it s Australian, sometimes it s Japanese. Maybe there s more but I ve never tried anything else. Not sure why people say they re rushed, because the staff is always super accommodating. But at the same time, you re eating steak and fries and you know there s a line. Pay it forward and don t be that guy that spends 2 hours at a popular place, it s not like you re going to tip 100% They come around the line and ask for whoever wants bar seating, so it s a great way to skip the line and get a seating earlier. Bartenders are great, and a single pour of Macallan 12 is $18 for a 2oz pour which is absolutely amazing. Let me tell you, this place is not just Tik Tok famous. Chef Laurent Tourondel knocked it out of the park with this concept of a single item menu. Also, if you don t already, follow their social media accounts. The Instagram account stories are absolutely hilarious. All in all, so worth.

The fries, the peppercorn sauce were great! The steak was just ok. They Nicole and dime you for sides and bread. Their services are rushed and the staff is in a hurry to push people out. Mediocre service. Not worth the hour wait.

Dont wait in line for this plenty of other businessess locally with better and more inexpensive than waiting on the line for a skirt steak. Good concept for the unlimited fries but they give you so much the first time I doubt if anyone makes it to a refill.

Top spot in chelsea. Great skirt steak. Sauce on point. Only one bad thing. The wait. Coming there as a 5ppl table isn t easy. But an hour + wait outside. Add some heater on the sidewalk Beside that everything great. And special mention to the cake cart lady. She s the sweetest

DONT COME HERE. Checked the website this morning - no reservations for parties under 7, okay no problem. Checked the website for the address on our way there and there was all of a sudden notice saying they re closing early for a party at 8. Still not a problem, because we re in line by 7:15. Was told at 7:30 they re closing now. Terrible, the host was smug and basically told us it s not his problem. Why wasn t there a disclosure of early closure early in the morning. Completely ruined date night. Won t be coming back
My family had a wonderful time at Skirt Steak celebrating a birthday. Our waiter, Trent was amazing and made the experience so much better.
4.3 out of 5 stars. Place looks great. Line goes kina quick. Not best skirt steak I had but on the higher tier for sure. Sides were amazing. Fries are kinda perfect. Friendly staff.

I like the concept of this place, but it s not worth the wait or the hype. At its core, $28 for steak/fries/a salad seems like a good deal. However, the normal steak is quite small and not that good, the fries were over cooked and oily, and the salad had a bitter taste to it. We paid for the upgraded wagyu steak, which tasted far better but cost $60 (for comparisson, you can have a full meal at Cote, a Michelin stared Korean bbq resturant, for $55). Not worth the price. We also tried the garlic bread which was as hard as a rock. Also, they do not take reservations, and most nights the minimum wait will be ~1 hour. Wanted to try it so we sucked it up and waited, but it wasn t worth it. With regards to the resturant itself, the inside of the resturant is very nicely designed and the staff are friendly. But overall, the wait is too long and the quality is too low to justify coming back.

Saturday night, got on line at 10 mins to 8 did no get seated until almost 930 pm. Serve an 8 Oz portion per person of steak.  I asked for medium bit it was more rare then I would like.  My friend asked for well and got medium. The fries are good. They are very similar to McDs salty and crispy. They sides are ok. For the price, $28 per person, Def not bad. The drinks were strong for additional $10. Desserts are also additional $10 looks decent. Did not try it. Our waiter was distracted and overwhelmed but did check in a couple of times. The space is nice.
Delicious food and very cheap for nyc but 2 hours on line !!!
Only place in new York that they charge $10 for garlic bread  . If you want a better steak its $30 , same goes for salad. Over hyped.
Food and staff were amazing. Features: You are appropriately spaced out. Dine in: Yes
review_translated_text: Dine in: Yes

review_text: Visited on Mar 27th with a friend and waited 1.5hrs to be seated around 7:30PM. The table was wobbly and when I told one of the hostesses it was immediately addressed. Our waitress came and we ordered a side of spinach and garlic bread, which was a bit small for what you paid for but fine. The steak was a fine, a bit burnt but passable. Where we had issues was with service because the servers would ask my guest if she was done with her food and then proceed to take my food as well although I literally had fork in hand. They had also asked if we would like a refill on fries but they never came back to provide the fries. Finally servers/busboys came back shortly after and started to take our food again taking only a half eaten spinach side, this time without asking at all. Honestly the whole experience started to feel very rushed at the end and felt like they were kicking us out. Food is good for the price but with its current popularity mixed with ok service think you are better waiting until the popularity dies down a bit before going to visit. This was my second visit, the first was during opening week and service was significantly better. If you want a true steakhouse service and experience, I definitely suggest visiting a traditional steakhouse instead.
we had a short wait. we loved it=onlything for me is there is no option of baked potato and you have unlimited french fries= service was good

Yikes. Always busy so my fiance and I thought we would give it a try. After an hour wait, highly disappointed. Even if we were able to walk in I would have been very dissatisfied. Salad was extremely bitter, although some might like that. I ordered my steak medium, my fiance ordered hers rare. Hers was more cooked on the outside than mine, and when i say cooked i mean charred to a crisp. The only way to get a steak that burnt on the outside and that rare inside is to not clean pans between steaks. Hers tasted like absolute dirt. Mine was almost edible. Would not recommend to anyone
Great manager & staff, we had an issue with our reservation and they were very kind and professional in handling it. Food was delicious & drinks too!
Very long wait for an ok meal. Get in line an hour before it opens or go after the hype dies down. Didnt think it was worth the over an hour wait
Worth the wait. Had a great experience.
Amazing
Excellent service, we waited to pass but it was worth it
review_translated_text: Excelente atencion, esperamos  para pasar pero valio la pena

review_text: Genuinely speaking, it s a hit and miss. This is not the place if you are craving for steak. The meat is tiny and burned up, you can taste the bitterness of charcoaled black pepper and the sauce is just ok. Salads is mediocre, however the fries are quite tasty (fresh/hot) and bottomless. Overall it s just not worth the 45 mins wait and I wouldn t go back again.
Excellent food and service staff very friendly helpful

The line is not worth the wait. We got seated at a 6 person table with another couple at our table. There was an empty space between us but the seating arrangement was a little awkward. The deal that goes on is two people receive a shared steak with unlimited fries with a salad for $28 each. They brought us the salad to start which were chunks of uncut lettuce drenched in a lemon vinaigrette dressing. The steak amount was small for two and came VERY charred/ burned. Almost unable to eat. The unlimited fries were EXTREMELY salted and not fresh. Our dining experience was rushed and lasted maybe 30 minutes. This place is not worth waiting for to be rushed out. In addition, we ordered desert and it tasted as if it were out all day. A disappointing experience. This restaurant values quantity of people over quality of food.
This famous TikTok place lived up to the hype. Steak was amazing, while the salad and fries were pretty average.

New Tik Tok Hype but totally not worth it unless you only want unlimited fries. The meat was well cooked but not a lot of flavor. The fries were okay and the greens were nothing out of this world. Suggest going to a real steak house if that is what you really wanted. HARD PASS on this place.
Excellent food and offer with unlimited fries, just don t quite understand how they don t take reservations. Excellent, just be sure to arrive before they open if you don t like waiting in line!

The frequency of the fries reload was amazing. Youre in for a good time on those unlimited fries. Your belly will be sporting a hefty food baby. The skirt steak was also delicious. Id abstain from ordering other items just to take full advantage of the carb load, but the other offerings sounded pretty good. The interior is modern and exposed. I liked the wooden columns and just wood all around. However, the floors really retain the smell of spilled food/beer that emanated upwards which was a bit difficult to ignore while eating.

My daughter suggested this place and it s so cute and cozy. Everything was perfect. From the lighting, to the perfectly simple menu, to the rolling desert cart! We did have to wait outside in the cold, but for a short time. I ll definitely be back when I m in NYC.
First time at Skirt Steak. 40 minute wait, no reservations but it was worth the wait. That chocolate cake was awesome Unlimited fries and that garlic bread very good..

Operating Skirt Steak to accommodate the volume, expectations of consumers, all while making it look easy is an accomplishment that all diners should standup and applaud by the end of their meal. Steak and fries, seems easy right? The fries are classically prepared and they re done very well. To compare them to McDonalds well please by all means return to your scope of culinary expertise. For those of you criticizing the sauce options A) BBQ sauce does not belong on fries or these steaks B) Peppercorn Bearnaise - if you re not saucing your steak with it or dipping your fries in it, then do you even know what good food is? I ve been fortunate enough to dine here multiple times, and each time I am welcomed back by a perfectly executed rare steak, hot fries, refreshing salad, and a smiling and engaging team from the front of the house. Kudos to the kitchen team for nothing short of a miracle. And to the folks who left poor reviews, it s clear you re the same people who have never worked in retail or hospitality and certainly don t know good food.

Thanks to the girl who posted this restaurant on TikTok, the steak was delicious and fries were on point. For the price of $28 it s a steal, the steak was tender and with the sauce, it was delicious. Highly recommend if you re in the mood for steak and wouldn t mind waiting in line, I waited about 30 mins

It was the worst experience ever as soon as se walked in the employees gave us dirty looks we asked for a table and they  had a attitude about and the bartender guy was extremely rude. It was really bad vibe in the place I feel very uncomfortable and intimated and felt I was treated different due to how I look like. Don t recommend it couldn t been great if the customer service didn t suck. If I could 0 starts I will. Food was okay too
Arrive early in order to avoid long lines. The steak is really good, it was marinated, then broiled. Portions are not large. For a parilla, it s worth a try.
Got there around noon and took us about 15 minutes to get a table. The steak and fries are amazing!
Great service at the bar, and delicious food. The French fries could use a little bit less salt, but great dinner night over al! Hopefully you ll open one restaurant in Bushwick/Williamsburg soon!!!

Came here for dinner on a Wednesday with a friend. We arrived at 7pm and there was a line of about 8 parties ahead of us. I thought about bailing because the line was so long but I m glad we didn t. The line moved surprisingly fast and we were seated in 40 mins. The food was fantastic. We both got the regular meal (salad, skirt steak, and fries), and we also shared a slice of cheesecake for dessert. Everything was of good quality and everything tasted great as well. For the price of $28 per person before dessert, I think this place is totally worth it, and worth the trade off of having to wait in line. Will definitely be recommending to my friends.
Really good simple menu and fun atmosphere.

This place definitely lives up to the hype in regards to being a must dine in experience. Unless youre part of a party of 8+ and you have a reservation, you will be waiting in the line outside....but.....its totally worth it. Steak... delicious. Fries... delicious. Salad.....meh, its salad. Dessert cart.... delicious. Drinks... delicious.

The TikTok hype is real with this restaurant. Skirt Steak delivers on its promise of good steak, greens and unlimited french fries and, for $28 a meal, definitely wallet friendly. The dessert cart was a treat. Try the blood orange cheesecake. You wont regret it. Be ready to stand in line for a long while though. The line typically goes down the block. Worth it, in my opinion.

Food was delicious and the staff is really friendly the only concern is the waiting time we spent almost 2 hours in the cold waiting to get inside so if you are planning to go make sure you go in the line with plenty time to have dinner because the waiting is wild! The restaurant only offers reservation for party of 7 and more! They music was also really good and the environment in general of this place was r ally good so very worthy the wait :) I will definitely go back because the steak was cooked so perfectly  and the service was good

First off, I want to say that this place is fun! The service is amazing, staff are fun, and the decor is homely and cute - the vibes are impeccable! Now for the food - I want to say that for the price of $28, the fixed meal does seem like a good deal. However, to start, they already give you a large portion of fries. Chances of you getting seconds for the bottomless fry deal are low, and if you did, youd probably say something like oh, just a little bit please. The steak itself is quite a small portion. In my pictures, unfortunately I was too hungry and forgot to take it before I started eating... but as you see on the hot plate, there are two spots of meat. Those were (before we began eating) two separate portions. Make of that what you will. Sides and dessert are extra charge, which is expected. For $28, the meal will definitely fill you up, just not necessarily on the steak. I love the sauce they serve with the steak, and the steak itself is cooked beautifully. I do want to mention though that as a whole, the meal was extremely salty for me. The seasonings are heavy - be it the salad, fries, or steak. The sides that we ordered, such as the Spinach gratin and potato/bacon side were also extremely salty. The only break I had was taking enormous gulps of water. The dessert on the other hand was wonderful.  Not too sweet, but still rich enough to make me feel like I was indulging in a dessert. I ordered the citrus cheesecake. I want to say that this place is worth the experience. The food is good and so is the atmosphere. Staff are so so friendly. However, if youre looking for a larger quantity of steak and perhaps just less of a sodium blast in general, you might as well buy a nice cut of ribeye or whatever you prefer, cook it up at home, and season to your liking. To me, it isnt worth waiting out in the cold for several hours like other reviews had mentioned. I arrived on a Thursday 20 minutes before opening and was seated promptly. While Im glad I tried out the place and joined the hype train for a sec, I probably wont be coming again unless their menu gets an update.
Im impressed, food is excellent, nothing fancy just well done. I was there after 2 on Saturday and it was almost full.  Definitely a place to go
Got there before open and happy I did because the line gets real long. The service was outstanding and the sides are amazing. Definitely worth the price.

Where in New York can you possibly eat a delicious salad, the best skirt steak and unlimited crispy french fries for under $30? At SKIRT STEAK! The restaurant is beautifully decorated with a casual ambience, the food is outstanding and if you still have room for dessert (I always have room for dessert) you will be delighted. I definitely recommend the flan! Fantastic experience!
Excellent steak great fries!!! Highly recommended AAA++++
Nice  and clean place  very pleasant staff just  wish I could have a menu with different choices.......

The true reality was, it was not spectacularly astonishing as the hype about it. The waiting was moderately terrible. You will go in faster if you re 4 or more people even if you re not first in line. The salad and bread was not fresh. The skirt steak we got for two people seemed less than I saw in others customer s plates. To add on, for the same amount of meat that we got can be recall that is the same amount of meat I get alone in some restaurants for less money. Plus, the taste of the steak wasn t special, it s the same taste you can find in a regular restaurant in the city. Overall I would rate it 5 out of 10

Amazing that I got in with just 15 mins wait. I was told the best time to go if you want to AVOID the long queue (2 hrs  ) is to go during weekend lunch. If you are solo, ask for bar seats u might be able to get seated quicker. They don t take reservation unless it s party of 7 and up. You don t put ur name down anywhere bc there is no list, u just need to stand in line with ur complete party and inch up the line slowly. When u are next in line at the door, someone from inside will open the door and assist.  U will see many ppl trying to storm in to the hostess stand behind the door to put their name down, but the manager has his system in control and pushes back these ppl to go back in the line. It s definitely worth it, $28 u get a beautiful classic green salad w/ mixed herbs and vinaigrette, the skirt steak is served on a cast iron skillet with some kind of brown sauce (does not taste like peppercorn sauce), temp of the steak was well executed, juicy and a little bit of a biTe since it s skirt steak, the char from the grill was exactly what I was looking for, they served the unlimited fries from a big bowl, the server was walking around the dining room offering fries refill. Ambience was great, lively and bustling, interior design looks like a cedar wood chalet which is a bit of a disconnect imo. There were sides of the day available for around $10-$12, and we ordered the spinach gratin which was great! I heard some days they have potato gratin as an option too. Dessert was from a gueridon cart, some classic cakes and they all looked really good, we tried the chocolate tart and it was good. Service was tip top, friendly, attentive, professional and hands on. Must visit and will definitely return. Great job to the team!

We came here for dinner and waited in line about 30 minutes before the restaurant opened and it was worth the wait. Is simple and limited concept but they make the steak worth it. It is cooked and seasoned perfectly. The bottomless fries are great. The salad at the start had an dressing on it that may have had to much oil in it. Just lack flavor. The staff were amazing and friendly. Very quick to help you and never a wait for more fries or beverages. Definitely recommend to anyone.

Came into Skirt Steak on a Wednesday night. Party of four and we waited around a half an hour. The hostess was nice and got us seated relatively quickly. When we sat, we were greeted by our waiter. It was explained to us that there are three ways to cook the steak, either rare, medium, or well done - and that the meal comes with unlimited fries and salad to start. He brought us some still water and asked us if wed like bread to start - he said yes. When we were brought the bread, there were 6 pieces for 4 people. Not to mention the fact that nobody ever mentioned wed be charged $10 for BREAD. I thought this was an extremely predatory sales tactic, but whatever. Then, the salads came. Everybody at the table had salad that was way too bitter to eat. At first, we thought it was the dressing, but after asking for another salad with the dressing on the side, we noticed the lettuce was inedible - it was too bitter to eat. Upon further inspection, we noticed that the lettuce had to have been spoiled. As a waiter of 3 years myself, I have never heard one account of lettuce being spoiled or bitter  Then, we asked for an order of bread for the table and again were given not even enough for 4 people to eat two slices of bread. When we asked for more, we were told wed be charged, even though we were charged the $10 for the bread initially AND we didnt eat any salad. Not to mention the fact that they dont have any salad dressing OTHER than ONE SINGLE vinaigrette, or the fact that the only real dipping sauce they have for their unlimited fries is ketchup, mayo, and siracha. Almost $40 a person without the dessert and I cant eat my fries with BBQ sauce or my salad with caesar dressing. Next, the meat was brought. The only highlight of the meal and the only reason Im giving this experience a two star. I was very upset because I asked for my meat medium, and more on the pink side if possible, and the waiter just nodded his head and never made sure my meat was pink. The unlimited fries that came with my meal became cold within seconds - indicating that fries were not fresh. On top of everything, during sitting for a 2-hour meal, our fries were replenished twice. The meat was OKAY. Nothing to write home about, but at least I got something filling that I could eat throughout all of this. On top of everything, our waiter checked on us once after getting our orders - thats it. We were served primarily by the busboys. I wish I could say this was the end of my experience, but it wasnt. We asked to split the bill four ways and the waiter told me that the machine doesnt do this. I dont understand how thats possible? As someone who has operated an OS responsible for a restaurant, and as someone who has easily split checks 3 ways - I knew this was a lie. The waiter did not attempt to be helpful at all, and instead insisted we only give him 2 cards. I understand that running a restaurant costs money, but when youre paying $5 for a slim glass of Coca-Cola that PERHAPS houses a half a can, or when youre charging $10 for bread [unheard of], at least make sure your computers [in 2022] are capable of paying checks. The funniest part to me is that the waiter came up to the table with his hands behind his back, asked us if we were ready for the check, and when we said yes, he pulled the check out and handed it to us - absolutely rushing to get us out of the restaurant to flip the table. Lets recount my experience: -30 minute wait, inedible salad, predatory sales tactics [selling bread for $10?], no real help from my waiter, meat not cooked to my liking, the only time the waiter showed us any real attention was to get his tip, no sauces, no dressings other than ONE shallot vinagrette At least the fries were good though, right? This place needs a lot of work.

Unlimited fries. Now I have your attention, Skirt Steak offers a high-quality dinner at an affordable price. The entree selection is reduced to one item and the dining experience is friendly and efficient. This isnt the Gallaghers or Keens steakhouse treatment, but youll leave Skirt Steak content and happy. Detailed review below: Skirt Steak first presented me an interior gabled with a barn like framing bathed in warm light. Inviting and friendly are both the aesthetic and the staff. When walking to my table there was an energy in the air as other diners ate, conversed, and enjoyed their meal. Great ambiance. The table was adorned with neatly folded napkins nestling card stock menus. Utensils and cups befittingly positioned. The surface was covered in a paper place setting with the words: Greens, Skirt Steak, Fries / $28 stamped on the corners. This simple mantra is the basis of simple elegance. I glanced once again around the room and appreciated the rustic design. Even the speakers were made of light-colored wood to match the framing. Their menu is clean and easy to read with a spartan grouping of wines, beer, cocktails, and dessert. The wine and beer arrays are diverse enough to satisfy most palates while the cocktail selection offers riffs on a few classics. The titular Skirt Steak is offered in only three temperatures: rare, medium, and well. I ordered a Skirt Manhattan and a rare steak with spinach. Bread arrived before the meal with soft spreadable butter. The bread had a firm crust with a soft interior while the butter was rich and salted. The Skirt Manhattan was textbook; spirit forward with just enough vermouth to cut the harshness of the whiskey. The default green of the meal was a small salad of raw leafy veggies with herbs and a marinade. It tasted of fennel and dill drizzled with olive oil and a dash of lemon. I must say the salad is underrated. It brought a freshness to the experience and prepared me for the heavier main course. The steak was crusted on the exterior and served sliced on a griddle exposing the pink center. Fries were thin, crispy, and well salted. On its own, the steak was properly seasoned and the combination of the textures was lovely. There was a sauce which appeared to be bearnaise served on the side. I can only describe the sauce as culinary napalm as it was so viscous it could stick to anything and make it fire. Spinach was tender and flavorful. Unlimited fries sounds amazing but in the big picture the meal is so complete the unlimited fries are more of a novelty than a necessity. The star of the dinner was the dessert. I did not expect to be blown away as I do not have a sweet tooth but when the dessert cart rolled to the table, I knew I was in for a treat. The elaborate glass and wood chest matched the rustic aesthetic of the restaurant and emitted an aura as if it was the arc of the covenant. My table ordered a few pastries. The flan is the best Ive ever had, I still yearn for the chocolate tart with berries, and the paris-brest was delicate and decadent. My only complaint with both the desert and the restaurant is that they did not serve coffee. Seems like an unfortunate oversight as coffee would have enhanced the wonderful dessert. Overall skirt steak delivers a high-quality meal at an affordable price with excellent service in a relaxed yet stylish atmosphere. Five stars.

review_text: Master of One Its better to have one item on the menu done perfectly than to have a large menu of poorly executed dishes. I present to you @skirtsteak.nyc, the eponymously named restaurant known for serving only Skirt steak. There is only 1 thing on their menu which is conveniently printed on the left hand corner of table. $28 for the full course menu. Consisting of a field green salad, skirt steak and endless handmade fries. Upon being seated the waiter took our drink order and gave us a basket of bread, which was great. It had a crunchy crust with fluffy soft inside that paired great with butter. It was simply great bread. The field green salad is adequate, its a salad. The greens are fresh and earthy/herby in flavor, I cant remember if there was dressing but then again this is a salad at a steak restaurant its not suppose to be memorable. I managed to finish it, my brother did not. The skirt steak, the star of the show, arrived shortly after we were done with our salads. And cooked perfectly to the temperature requested (medium rare). The outside had a nice sear and the overall steak was extremely flavorful and tender. I didnt know skirt steak would be done this well. It is also served with like a garlic butter sauce, I tried a piece with the sauce but honestly it wasnt needed. The steak is great on it own. Instead use that sauce for the endless fries. The endless fries are served alongside the steak and yes its truly endless, as soon as you empty the bowl they bring a refill, until you ask them to stop. And the fries are also top-notch; crispy and fresh. So good that we had 3 refills. The menu also has a changng number of  daily sides ($9) that waiter will introduce. We went with the cauliflower gratin which was just a cheesy cauliflower delight! And last and certainly not least they have an amazing dessert cart that gets pushed out after you finish and do yourself a favor, order dessert. I had this amazing hazelnut flavor dream of a dessert and I forget what my brother ordered. I wish I could remember the name of it but instead I used that limited space in my memory to just remember that taste of that dessert. If you are ever in NYC; Do yourself a favor, go. **this review is of my dining experience from November 24th, 2021**

review_text: This place has been overrun by influencers and therefore ruined a good second experience here. My first time at Skirt was within the first month of opening and it was great. All of the decently separated tables are reserved for influencers and friends of the owner and large groups.  I would completely understand that if those tables were full to begin with.  That was not the case at all last night. Our dinner lasted about an hour and a half and the influencer tables were only half booked the entire time we were there so we were pretty annoyed that we were denied a decent empty table. My favorite part is the rolling dessert cart! This glass chariot of goodies passes you at eye level while your eating certainly reminds you to save room for something tasty.
